text: Lecanora muscigena is a species of lichen in the family Lecanoraceae. It was described as new to science in 2020 by Dag Øvstedal & Alan Fryday. It is found in the subantarctic island of South Georgia, where it grows on ground-dwelling mosses. ==See also== *List of Lecanora species ==References== Category:Fungi described in 2020 muscigena
title: Lecanora muscigena
